docs.abstract: The Dodd-Frank regulatory overhaul, the government's response to the 2008 financial crisis, was designed to be a slap in the face to Wall Street. But Mitt Romney, during the first debate of the presidential campaign, claims it was "the biggest kiss that's been given to New York banks I've ever seen."

docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney aggressively pressed President Obama on the economy, jobs and health care in a debate that avoided the one-liners that sometimes emerge from presidential face-offs.

headline.seo: Obama and Romney Hold First Debate
headline.main: Obama and Romney, in First Debate, Spar Over Fixing the Economy
headline.sub: Candidates Quarrel on Deficit and Taxes in First Meeting
headline.print_headline: Obama and Romney, in First Debate, Spar Over Fixing the Economy

docs.abstract: Pres Obama and Mitt Romney appear in the first televised presidential debate of the election cycle, with each arguing that his policies would improve the lives of the middle class; Romney forcefully engages Obama throughout the 90-minute event as they clash over the economy, jobs and health care, but neither candidate delivers a knockout blow; Romney succeeds in showing that he could project equal stature to the president, perhaps offering a lift to his campaign that could reorder a close race.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney aggressively pressed President Obama on the economy, jobs and health care in a debate that avoided the one-liners that sometimes emerge from presidential face-offs.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new method for analyzing newborns’ genetic histories sped the process of zeroing in on a disease-causing mutation from weeks or months to a couple of days.

headline.seo: New Test of Babies’ DNA Speeds Diagnosis
headline.main: Infant DNA Tests Speed Diagnosis of Rare Diseases
headline.print_headline: Rapid Analysis of Infants’ DNA Aids Diagnosis of Rare Diseases

docs.abstract: New method of quickly scanning a newborn baby's entire DNA to pinpoint disease-causing mutation is published in journal Science Translational Medicine; study's authors say that technique, which provides results in days rather than the typical weeks or months, could be one of the first practical fruits of the revolution in sequencing an individual's entire DNA.
docs.snippet: A new method for analyzing newborns’ genetic histories sped the process of zeroing in on a disease-causing mutation from weeks or months to a couple of days.
